refnamediv.refpurpose: Update parameters of a service or service instance

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The aq update service command updates the parameters of a service or a service instance. If called without any options, the command will just refresh the plenary templates of the service instance named INSTANCE, or of all instances if no --instance option was specified.

listitem.para: The name of the service to update. If the --instance option is also specified, then the parameters of the service instance named INSTANCE will be updated. Otherwise, the global parameters of the service will be updated.
Update the parameters of the service instance named INSTANCE.

Specify the maximum number of clients a service instance may have. If applied to a service instance, then the value will override the default defined at the service level. If applied to the service as a whole, all instances that do not have an override will pick up the new value.

Existing clients of a service instance are not immediately affected, even if there are more than NUMBER already. However, if a service instance is over limit, and a client of that instance is reconfigured using aq make or aq reconfigure, then that client will be moved to a different instance.

Reset the maximum number of clients to the default. If applied to the whole service, it will set the global default to unlimited. If applied to a service instance, it will clear the previous client limit override, and the service instance will revert to using the default value set globally for the service.

Specify if servers of the service need to have the list of their clients in their profile. There are many services like DNS, NTP etc. where the server does not really need to know anything about its potential clients. Turning off the generation of the client list for such services improves performance, and also makes the server profiles smaller.
Update the comments of the service named SERVICE, or the service instance named INSTANCE if the --instance option was also specified.
